creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Carol Brooks
description: mountain and water landscape with temple complexes; large cliffs and boulders rise out of water at LL; small, open structure with pointed thatched roof juts into water; room has tatami floor and is filled with pots; a small boat floats to the R of structure; gnarled, dense trees grow from rocks LLC; temple complex rises out of fog and treetops in middle ground; large, sweeping mountain with temple complex at top at UL; small moon rising center R
markings: L side of rolled scroll, black pen: [Left]; gourd shaped intaglio seal LLC; square relief LLC;  white circular sticker tip of L roller cap: [SJ/70]; bright yellow circular sticker tip of L roller cap: [E8]
medium: Ink, color, and gold on paper
title: Landscape of Winter and Spring, from a triptych of Bodhidharma and Landscapes of the Four Seaons
